primaryPhylogenyCitation.title: A toothed turtle from the Late Jurassic of China and the global biogeographic history of turtles.

phylorefs.label: Testudinata
phylorefs.dwc:scientificNameAuthorship: Joyce, W. G., Parham, J. F., Anquetin, J., Claude, J., Danilov, I. G., Iverson, J. B., Kear, B., Lyson, T. R., Rabi, M., Sterli, J.

dwc:namePublishedIn.title: Klassification und kurze Geschichte der Vierfüßigen Thiere (translation by F. D. Behn).

phylorefs.cladeDefinition: The apomorphy-based clade name, for which a complete turtle shell, as inherited by Testudo graeca Linnaeus 1758 is an apomorphy. A 'complete turtle shell' is herein defined as a composite structure consisting of a carapace with interlocking costals, neurals, peripherals, and a nuchal, together with the plastron comprising interlocking epi-, hyo-, meso- (lost in Testudo graeca), hypo-, xiphiplastra and an entoplastron.
